intro: Dactylorhiza guimaraesii, commonly known as the Guimarães orchid, is a species of orchid native to Portugal. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, erect stem and a single, showy flower. The plant features a basal rosette of dark green, fleshy leaves and produces a single, spurred orchid flower with a distinctive pinkish-red color. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats and is often found in woodland areas. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is a subject of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
